text: import pkg as p , in julia as seems missing

elements.text: import pkg as p , in julia as seems missing
It is there, in julia 1.6+.

text: For now, you can do `const p = pkg`

elements.text: For now, you can do `const p = pkg`

text: there was a long discussion for long time (since Julia 1.1 I believe) on what was the preferred syntax for this. People were split on the `as` bit and were proposing alternatives to no one's satisfaction ... but it seems that it was the one that won in the end

text: Also whats the equivalent of pyenv to have multiple version n use them with pluto

elements.text: Also whats the equivalent of pyenv to have multiple version n use them with pluto

text: the default package manager can make multiple environments with separate package selection, although they are called projects in Julia not envs, however effectively is the same thing.

elements.text: the default package manager can make multiple environments with separate package selection, although they are called projects in Julia not envs, however effectively is the same thing.

text: the only thing it can't handle are different julia versions, that you have to handle yourself

elements.text: the only thing it can't handle are different julia versions, that you have to handle yourself

text: for handling multiple julia versions, I have seen people using <https://asdf-vm.com> ... but I haven't used it myself ... yet

elements.text: for handling multiple julia versions, I have seen people using
... but I haven't used it myself ... yet

text: one more thing, I always have several julia versions in my computer (usually the last major 1.x version and a couple minor 1.x.y  versions) in practice I always use the latest stable julia version and I have never had problems with backward compatibility except perhaps with `Cxx.jl` and `Makie.jl` ... but I don't really use those that much.
